com.samsung.android.sdk.chord

Interface SchordChannel


  • public interface SchordChannel
    This interface provides methods for managing Chord channel operations.
    Channels are used to isolate the communications of a specific application to ensure the co-existence of different applications in the same local network.
    Each node in a channel is identified by a unique node name, which is used to address peers.
    Since:
    1.5
    Version:
    2.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  SchordChannel.StatusListener
      This listener interface receives Chord channel events.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()
        Get the channel name.
        Returns:
        The channel name.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getJoinedNodeList

         getJoinedNodeList()
        Get the list of nodes on the channel.
        Returns:
        The list of node names on the channel. If there are no nodes on the channel, this method returns an empty list.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - Thrown when an attempt is made to modify the list.
        Since:
        1.0

      • sendData

        void sendData(String toNode,
            String payloadType,
            byte[][] payload)
        Send the specified data to the specified node on the channel.
        Parameters:
        toNode - The name of the node receiving the data. This is a mandatory parameter.
        payloadType - The user defined message type. This is a mandatory parameter.
        payload - The data package you want to send
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Thrown when the network is disconnected or Chord is stopped.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when the arguments passed are invalid.
        RuntimeException - Thrown when the data transfer fails.
        Since:
        1.5

      • sendDataToAll

        void sendDataToAll(String payloadType,
                 byte[][] payload)
        Send the specified data to all the nodes on the channel.
        Parameters:
        payloadType - The user defined message type. This is a mandatory parameter.
        payload - The data package you want to send.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Thrown when the network is disconnected or Chord is stopped.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when the arguments passed are invalid.
        RuntimeException - Thrown when the data transfer fails.
        Since:
        1.5

      • sendUdpData

        String sendUdpData(String toNode,
                 int reliableTime,
                 boolean respFlag,
                 String payloadType,
                 byte[][] payload,
                 String sessionName)
                   throws IllegalStateException,
                          IllegalArgumentException,
                          RuntimeException
        Send the specified data to the specified node on the channel using UDP.
        Parameters:
        toNode - The name of the node receiving the data.
        reliableTime - The time period (in milliseconds) for holding the payload in the sending buffer for reliability.
        10 ms is recommended.
        -1 (infinite) is used for fully reliable UDP.
        respFlag - Set to true to receive the onUdpDataDelivered() notification from the receiver. Set to false not to receive the notification.
        payloadType - The user defined message type.
        payload - The data package you want to send.
        sessionName - The user defined name to create UDP session. It enables parallel data transfer through the respective sessions.
        Returns:
        The request ID of the data sent. The ID is used to track the delivery of data to the receiver.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Thrown when the network is disconnected or Chord is stopped.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when the arguments passed are invalid.
        RuntimeException - Thrown when the data transfer fails.
        Since:
        2.0

      • sendUdpDataToAll

        String sendUdpDataToAll(int reliableTime,
                      boolean respFlag,
                      String payloadType,
                      byte[][] payload,
                      String sessionName)
                        throws IllegalStateException,
                               IllegalArgumentException,
                               RuntimeException
        Send the specified data to all the nodes on the channel using UDP.
        Parameters:
        reliableTime - The time period (in milliseconds) for holding the payload in the sending buffer for reliability.
        10 ms is recommended.
        -1 (infinite) is used for fully reliable UDP.
        respFlag - Set to true to receive the onUdpDataDelivered() notification from the receiver. Set to false not to receive the notification.
        payloadType - The user defined message type.
        payload - The data package you want to send.
        sessionName - The user defined name to create UDP session. It enables parallel data transfer through the respective sessions.
        Returns:
        The request ID of the data sent. The ID is used to track the delivery of data to the receiver.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Thrown when the network is disconnected or Chord is stopped.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when the arguments passed are invalid.
        RuntimeException - Thrown when the data transfer fails.
        Since:
        2.0

      • sendFile

        String sendFile(String toNode,
              String fileType,
              String filePath,
              int timeoutMsec)
                throws FileNotFoundException
        Send the specified file to the specified node on the channel.
        Parameters:
        toNode - The name of the node receiving the file. This is a mandatory parameter.
        fileType - The user defined file type.
        filePath - The absolute path of the file you want to transfer. This is a mandatory parameter.
        timeoutMsec - The amount of time in milliseconds to wait for the receiver to accept the file receive requests. It can be delayed by the period of a routine for checking an expiration.
        Returns:
        Transmission ID of the file transfer. Pass this ID when you call the cancelFile() method to cancel the file transfer.
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - Thrown when the specified file is not found.
        IllegalStateException - Thrown when the network is disconnected or Chord is stopped.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when the arguments passed are invalid.
        RuntimeException - Thrown when the file transfer fails.
        Since:
        1.5

      • acceptFile

        void acceptFile(String exchangeId,
              int chunkTimeoutMsec,
              int chunkRetries,
              long chunkSize)
        Accept the receive request for the specified file transfer.
        Can be called once an onFileWillReceive() notification is received.
        Parameters:
        exchangeId - Transmission ID of the file transfer.
        chunkTimeoutMsec - The amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a data chunk.
        chunkRetries - The number of times Chord tries to resend a data chunk when chunks are not being received. The default value is 2.
        chunkSize - The data chunk size.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Thrown when the network is disconnected or Chord is stopped.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when the arguments passed are invalid.
        RuntimeException - Thrown when acceptance of the file transfer request fails.
        Since:
        1.5

      • rejectFile

        void rejectFile(String exchangeId)
        Reject the receive request for the specified file transfer.
        Call this method when the onFileWillReceive() callback method is called.
        Parameters:
        exchangeId - Transmission ID of the file transfer request you want to reject.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Thrown when the network is disconnected or Chord is stopped.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when the argument passed is invalid.
        RuntimeException - Thrown when rejection of the file transfer fails.
        Since:
        1.5

      • cancelFile

        void cancelFile(String exchangeId)
        Cancel the specified file transfer.
        You can call this method on the sender-side before the receiver node accepts or rejects the file transfer or on either side of the file transfer when the transfer is underway.
        Parameters:
        exchangeId - Transmission ID of the file transfer.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Thrown when the network is disconnected or Chord is stopped.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when the argument passed is invalid.
        RuntimeException - Thrown when cancelation of the file transfer fails.
        Since:
        1.5

      • getNodeIpAddress

        String getNodeIpAddress(String nodeName)
        Get the IPv4 address of the specified node.
        Parameters:
        nodeName - The name of the node for which you want to find an IPv4 address.
        Returns:
        The IPv4 Address.
        If the specified node is not on the channel, this method returns null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when the argument passed is invalid.
        Since:
        1.5

      • sendMultiFiles

        String sendMultiFiles(String toNode,
                    String fileType,
                     listFilePath,
                    int timeoutMsec)
                      throws FileNotFoundException
        Send the specified list of files to the specified node on the channel.
        Parameters:
        toNode - The name of the node receiving the multiple file transfer.This is a mandatory parameter.
        fileType - The user defined file type.
        listFilePath - The list of the absolute paths of files you want to transfer. This is a mandatory parameter.
        timeoutMsec - The amount of time in milliseconds to wait for the receiver to accept the multiple file transfer receive request. It can be delayed by the period of a routine for checking an expiration.
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - Thrown when a specified file is not found.
        IllegalStateException - Thrown when the network is disconnected or Chord is stopped.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when the arguments passed are invalid.
        RuntimeException - Thrown when the multiple file transfer fails.
        Since:
        1.5

      • acceptMultiFiles

        void acceptMultiFiles(String taskId,
                    int chunkTimeoutMsec,
                    int chunkRetries,
                    long chunkSize)
        Accept the receive request for the specified multiple file transfer.
        Call this method when the onFileWillReceive() callback method is called.
        Parameters:
        taskId - Transmission ID of the multiple file transfer request.
        chunkTimeoutMsec - The amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a data chunk.
        chunkRetries - The number of times Chord tries to resend a data chunk when chunks are not being received.
        chunkSize - The data chunk size.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Thrown when the network is disconnected or Chord is stopped.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when the arguments passed are invalid.
        RuntimeException - Thrown when acceptance of the multiple file transfer request fails.
        Since:
        1.5

      • rejectMultiFiles

        void rejectMultiFiles(String taskId)
        Reject the receive request for the specified multiple file transfer.
        Call this when the onFileWillReceive() callback method is called.
        Parameters:
        taskId - Transmission ID of the multiple files transfer request.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Thrown when the network is disconnected or Chord is stopped.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when the argument passed is invalid.
        RuntimeException - Thrown when rejection of the multiple file transfer fails.
        Since:
        1.5

      • cancelMultiFiles

        void cancelMultiFiles(String taskId)
        Cancel the specified multiple file transfer.
        You can call this method on the sender-side before the receiver node accepts or rejects the file transfer or on either side of the file transfer when the transfer is underway.
        Parameters:
        taskId - Transmission ID of the multiple files transfer.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Thrown when the network is disconnected or Chord is stopped.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when the argument passed is invalid.
        RuntimeException - Thrown when cancelation of the multiple file transfer fails.
        Since:
        1.5

      • isSecureChannel

        boolean isSecureChannel()
        Check if the channel is secure.
        Returns:
        True if the channel is secure.
        Since:
        1.5
